__e: When your lover starts to have feelings of loyalty to your husband you can be sure it's the beginning of the end.
Whether it's out of fear or loyalty or acting on Johnson's orders I don't know, but not one of them will tell us a thing.
The girl has bought the young man here to look for him but really she has come back out of loyalty to me
Its sense of fair play and justice.
"I have the loyalty of my girls, and she said, "Do you?"
Why didn't you tell her the rest of it?
I've proved my loyalty and it's about time you gave me an unqualified vote of confidence.
This evening will be our way to thank you and obviously Michael for years of loyalty and support.
Thank you for your loyalty and understanding, we wish you health and safety. We will see you very soon.
Perhaps you'd like to discuss this with your family.
- David, your loyalty is admirable, but...
I think you're just being loyal, but I respect you for it.
No one mentioned your loyalties, but we've heard a lot about his family, his fondness for white cake, his fondness for horses...
"Not because of duty or loyalty, for money?"
I understand your sense of duty, of loyalty to your Captain, but we have something stronger... a connection that goes beyond duty and loyalty.
I'm hoping that whatever you have to say has nothing to do with my loyalty to him.
But your loyalty to our cause must be considered.
